title: From Early Laws To Arizona: How Abortion Laws Have Evolved In The US
content: The Arizona Supreme Court has ruled that foetuses can be termed "unborn human beings" in voter pamphlets regarding abortion rights.
summary: The Arizona Supreme Court has ruled that foetuses can be termed "unborn human beings" in voter pamphlets regarding abortion rights.

title: 74-Year-Old Woman Killed By 13 Foot Python In Indonesia
content: An elderly woman was found dead after being attacked by a python in central Indonesia, police and local officials said Friday, the third such death in the province in as many months.
summary: An elderly woman was found dead after being attacked by a python in central Indonesia, police and local officials said Friday, the third such death in the province in as many months.

title: Opinion: Trump, Musk, And The Importance Of 'Exaggeration' In Storytelling
content: Trump's conversation with Musk needs to be seen not as a "rambling" one which has significantly undermined his presidential prospects but as a tested strategy aimed at his constituents and swing voters.

title: US Court Calls Google Monopolist, Says It Violates Competition Law
content: On August 5, 2024, the US Court for the District of Columbia (DC) decided that Google was a monopolist, meaning it has durable market power as the dominant player in its field of "general search services". This is a violation of competition law.
summary: On August 5, 2024, the US Court for the District of Columbia (DC) decided that Google was a monopolist, meaning it has durable market power as the dominant player in its field of "general search services". This is a violation of competition law.

title: Matthew Perry "Froze" When Doctor Gave Him Large Ketamine Dose Before Death
content: Actor Matthew Perry, one of the leads of the superhit sitcom "Friends", seemed to "freeze up" after a doctor administered a "large dose" of ketamine two weeks before his overdose, according to a report.
summary: Actor Matthew Perry, one of the leads of the superhit sitcom "Friends", seemed to "freeze up" after a doctor administered a "large dose" of ketamine two weeks before his overdose, according to a report.

title: JD Vance's Bestselling Tale From Rags To Riches Can Be His Political Tool

title: Russian Spies Were Stealing US Tech During Cold War. Then FBI Did This

title: "Critical Shortage" Of Cholera Vaccine, Says WHO, Calls for Production Boost

title: Geneva Conventions Turn 75. Do Laws Of War Have A Chance In Today's Era?
content: This week marked 75 years since the adoption of the Geneva Conventions on August 12 1949. In theory, these rules of war are universally agreed by every nation. In practice, they are routinely violated everywhere.
summary: This week marked 75 years since the adoption of the Geneva Conventions on August 12 1949. In theory, these rules of war are universally agreed by every nation. In practice, they are routinely violated everywhere.

title: Australia Rejects 7000 Palestinian Visas, Approves More For Israelis: Report

title: Mpox Outbreak Could Soon Turn Into The Next Global Pandemic. Know More
